Has a description:
This ḥāshiya is published in the fourth volume of Intishārāt kungra-e Muḥaqqiq Ardabīlī (pp. 137-168). The author expressed his wish to gloss on the entire work when he wrote:
و إن شاء اللّه سنكتب حاشية كاملة على تمام هذا الكتاب من أوّله إلى آخره ، فإنّي قد طالعته مرارا ، و خطر ببالي طائفة من التناقض و عدم العلم بمذاهب الناس ؛ خصوصا الشيعة و غيرها
See Hifdeh risāleh (Qum: Daftar-i kungreh-yi buzurgdāsht-i Muḥaqqiq Ardabīlī, 1375Sh/1996), p. 168. Al-Muḥaqqiq al-Ardabīlī taught Sharḥ al-ʿAḍudī to Ṣāḥib Maʿālim (d. 1011/1602) and Ṣāḥib Madārik (d. 1009/1600). See Rayḥānat al-adab 3:393; Rawḍāt al-jannāt 7:48.
A facsimile of microfilm #1660 of the manuscript at Markaz-i Iḥyāʾ-i Mīrath-i Islāmī.

Edition:Al-Wāfiya fī uṣūl al-fiqh - Majm.fulltext: Edition:Al-Wāfiya fī uṣūl al-fiqh - Majmaʿ al-Fikr al-Islāmī - 1992

Has editor(s): ʿAlī b. Muḥammad al-Sayyid ʿAlī Farmān al-Ḥanafī
Has a description:
The author is younger brother of [[al-Sayyid ʿAmīd al-Dīn ʿAbd al-Muṭṭalib]] (d. 754/1353) who also wrote a commentary on [[Tahdhīb al-wuṣūl ilā ʿilm al-uṣūl]] entitled [[Sharḥ al-Tahdhīb]]. Both brothers were nephews of [[al-ʿAllāma al-Ḥillī]]. The author composed this commentary during the life of his uncle.

He completed writing this sharḥ on the 25th of Rajab 704/21st February 1305 (or on the afternoon of Wednesday 15th of Rajab/10th of February.

For further details see Dh 23:207 #8653
Chapter no. 6, pp. 455-552

Edition:al-ʿUdda fī uṣūl al-fiqh/ʿUddat.fulltext: Edition:al-ʿUdda fī uṣūl al-fiqh/ʿUddat al-uṣūl (1417/1997) - Muḥammad Mahdī Ṭāhā Najaf

Has a description: This work is published along with its refutation by [[Mīrzā Muḥammad al-Akhbārī]] entitled [[Bughyat al-fuḥūl]].

This edition also contains the Arabic text. The top half page contains Arabic text and the remaining portion is translation. It should be noted that the translation on each page does not correspond to the Arabic text of that page. In other words, the text of translation outnumbers the text of Arabic text. The Arabic text is up to p. 142 but the translation continues till p. 245. The translation is done by Muḥammad Riḍā al-Tafrishī al-Naqūsānī (d.1364/1944).
